meanings.definition: A piece of furniture or other item that is sold in pieces and must be assembled by the buyer.
meanings.sent1: I bought a flatpack bookshelf and spent the afternoon putting it together.
meanings.sent2: The flatpack desk came with clear instructions for assembly.
meanings.sent3: Trying to assemble the flatpack dresser without the manual was a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a flatpack, scattered pieces waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent5: The flatpack wardrobe was like a puzzle waiting to be solved.

meanings.definition: To assemble furniture or other items that are sold in pieces.
meanings.sent1: I will flatpack the new bed frame this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She flatpacks all her furniture to save money on delivery.
meanings.sent3: He flatpacked the table in record time, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent4: The team flatpacked the shelves together, working in harmony.
meanings.sent5: Flatpacking the chair required patience and attention to detail.
